main event: On June 17, 1949, in Glendale, California, a civilian observer reported sighting two bright metallic, oval-shaped objects in the sky, reflecting the sun and appearing to be about 10 degrees over the horizon. The objects approached from the northeast, cruised along the valley, and then took off rapidly to the north-northwest before disappearing into the distance after a 1.5-minute sighting.
interesting points: The objects were described as bright metallic and oval-shaped, with no visible protrusions such as wings or stabilizers.
They reflected the sun brightly and were estimated to be about 4.5 miles away, appearing to be the size of approximately 1 inch at that distance.
The objects approached from the northeast, cruised along the valley, and then rapidly took off to the north-northwest before disappearing into the distance in a matter of seconds.
The observer reported clear weather conditions with 30 miles of visibility at the time of the sighting.
